metadata.title: What Noise Countermeasures Does Renesas CTSU1 Use?

sections.content:
Question:
What noise countermeasures does Renesas CTSU1 use?
Answer:
CTSU1 integrates the following noise countermeasures.
Dedicated power supply for touch
The Touch IP MCU's built-in regulator ensures stable detection results even when the MCU power supply wavers.
Reduced noise contamination achieved with low impedance input terminal
The SCF (Switched Capacitor Filter) is always connected to the power supply or GND, ensuring the input terminal has low impedance and is therefore sufficiency immune to noise.
Noise leveling achieved through integration of detection results
By integrating the detection result for a set period, the variation in detection can be leveled off, reducing the influence of noise.
CTSU sensor drive pulse phase shift
The Touch IP MCU is equipped with a CTSU sensor drive pulse phase shift circuit. Phase shift prevents synchronization of noise wave highs and lows, further reducing noise influence.
Edge diffusion of CTSU sensor drive pulse
By normalizing the edges of the CTSU sensor drive pulses with asynchronous signals, edge frequency can be diffused and noise influence reduced.
Suitable Products
RX113
RX130
RX231, RX230
